column7: Origin Australia is a leading energy company committed to revolutionising how Australians power their lives. We aim to drive a sustainable energy future by providing reliable, affordable, and environmentally responsible solutions. With a strong focus on innovation, customer-centricity, and sustainability, we strive to be at the forefront of the energy industry.

column6: Entities included in the organization's sustainability reporting
column7: Unless otherwise stated, in this report, a reference to 'Origin', 'Origin Energy', 'Group', 'Origin Group', 'Company', 'we', and 'our' is to Origin Energy Limited and its controlled entities and joint venture arrangements as outlined in our 2023 Annual Report.

column6: Reporting period, frequency, and contact point
column7: Origin Energy's 2023 Sustainability Report summarises Origin's performance on material social and environmental sustainability from 1 July 2022 to 30 June 2023 (FY2023).\t
The group restated the GHG emission data FY23.
Ernst & Young (EY) provides external financial and sustainability performance assurance.

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column13: Origin stands out in the market by providing an unparalleled customer experience at a lower cost. Our innovative approach combines cutting-edge technology, streamlined operations, and a customer-centric mindset.

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column13: Origin Go Zero Natural Gas is a pioneering product offered by Origin Australia, embodying our commitment to sustainable and eco-friendly energy solutions. It is a unique offering that allows customers to offset their natural gas usage by investing in certified carbon offset projects.
column20: Origin Go Zero Natural Gas, Australian businesses, GreenPower

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column13: Origin Go Zero LPG is an innovative and eco-conscious product offered by Origin Australia, reflecting our commitment to sustainability and environmental responsibility. This offering allows customers to offset the carbon emissions associated with their usage of LPG (liquefied petroleum gas).
column20: Origin Go Zero LPG, Climate Active-certified, Active obligations,

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column13: Origin Go Zero Electricity is an innovative product by Origin Australia, embodying our dedication to sustainability and environmental stewardship. This offering allows customers to consciously reduce their carbon footprint and contribute to a cleaner, greener future.

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column13: Origin's Carbon Management Solutions represent our commitment to address climate change and reduce carbon emissions proactively. We provide tailored solutions for businesses and organisations to effectively measure, manage, and mitigate their carbon footprint.
column20: Carbon management solutions, decarbonise, energy transition

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column13: The Malabar Biomethane Demonstration Project by Origin is a pioneering initiative focused on sustainable energy production and reducing carbon emissions. Located in Sydney, Australia, this project aims to demonstrate the potential of biomethane, a renewable natural gas derived from organic waste.
column20: Malabar Biomethane Demonstration, ARENA, Sydney Water

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column13: Startups will work alongside leading energy utilities from around the globe to deliver cutting-edge solutions and co-create the future of Energy. The Program will focus on working together to pilot projects, commercially deploy products, and facilitate investment opportunities, learning and development. Join us in accelerating the clean energy transition.
column20: Free Electrons, start-up, Open Innovation program

column7: In FY23, the group's total number of employees was 5,360.
Workers who are not employees consist of contractors and part-time workers.
The group governance structure consists of the Audit Committee, Safety and Sustainability Committee, Remuneration, People and Culture Committee, Risk Committee, and Nomination Committee.

column6: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
column7: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body is a meticulous and transparent process by our dedicated Nomination Committee.

column6: Chair of the highest governance body
column7: Scott Perkins was the chairman of the group during the reporting period.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in overseeing the management of impacts
column7: The Board's roles and responsibilities are formalised in a Board Charter, available on the Company's website. The Charter outlines those functions delegated to management and those reserved for the Board.\t

column6: Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts
column7: Senior leadership sets the tone by establishing clear policies, goals, and performance indicators related to sustainability and impact reduction.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column7: The highest governance body in Australia significantly focuses on sustainability reporting through its dedicated Safety and Sustainability Committee.
All Directors can access committee papers and attend committee meetings without conflict of interest.\t

column13: An online continuous listening platform that supports in-the-moment feedback through frequent pulse surveys and enables our people leaders to respond in real-time. Officevibe was trialled with our Retail team before being rolled out across the organisation.

Ombudsman complaints are vital to our commitment to customer satisfaction and service excellence. The Ombudsman is an independent authority that customers can turn to when they have concerns or issues about our products or services.
column14: In FY2023, the number of ombudsman complaints per 1,000 Origin customers was 1.8, up from 1.5 in FY2022, driven by a rise in the number of billing complaints related to the migration of our customers and complaints about price increases.
column20: Ombudsman complaints, 1,000 Origin customers, Complaints and resolutions

column6: Collective knowledge of the highest governance body
column7: Origin's Board members bring experience from various industries and backgrounds, including utilities, oil and gas, industrials, banking and finance, legal and technology.

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column7: The Directors regularly review the performance of the whole Board, Board committees and individual Directors, generally facilitated by an external consultant.
The Remuneration, People and Culture Committee and the Board consider the performance of the CEO and all members of the ELT when deciding whether to award performance-related remuneration.
The group approach to remuneration consists of long-term and short-term incentives.
"Over the past year we continued to execute our strategy at pace, against an ambition to lead the energy transition through cleaner energy and customer solutions."
The group policy commitment ranges from code of conduct, whistleblower, management approach, privacy and D&I Policy.

column13: The Cadetships Program is a structured initiative designed to nurture and develop future talent within the organisation. It allows individuals to gain hands-on experience, knowledge, and skills across various business areas while pursuing their education.

Direct bill relief is a customer-centric initiative to assist and support customers facing financial challenges. This program is designed to ease the burden of energy bills by offering flexible payment options and tailored solutions to suit individual circumstances.
column20: Direct bill relief, Energy affordability, vulnerable customers

column13: Community hotlines are dedicated channels for fostering direct and immediate communication with the communities we serve. These hotlines serve as a vital link, enabling individuals and communities to connect with Origin, voice their concerns, seek assistance, or share feedback.
column20: Community hotlines, Responding to complaints, grievance mechanism

column13: The Consumer Advocacy Panel is critical to our commitment to putting customers first. This panel represents an independent body that ensures consumer interests are at the forefront of our decision-making processes and policies.
column14: We have continued to grow the panel, increasing membership from around 3,000 customers in FY2021 to more than 6,600 members in FY2023.
column20: Consumer Advocacy Panel, Origin Exchange Customer, Insights Community

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column13: Origin ConcernLine is a dedicated platform Origin Australia provides to address customer, employee, and stakeholder concerns and feedback. It serves as a confidential and secure channel for reporting any ethical problems, compliance violations, misconduct, or issues related to business practices.
column20: Origin ConcernLine, Escalating a concern, speak up
